FacilityName: Giumarra Vineyards, Packing and Cold Storage

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



1.1 GIUMARRA VINEYARDS COLD STORAGE, RISK & PROCESS SAFETY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM



This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to

address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities:



Process Name Process Chemical Process Quantity(lbs.)

P3 - North System Ammonia 28,400

P4 - South System Ammonia 54,000

P5 - Pit Chlorination Chlorine 8,000

P6 - Potato Wash Chlorination Chlorine 4,000



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of

hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, and illnesses and avoid physical property damage.



Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage has an exemplary safety record, one that we are quite proud of. Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and

public safety. We have:



1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM plan to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well

2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage business practices

3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)



The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees protect themselves and our neighbors.



1.2 PROCESS DESCRIPTIONS



The Giumarra Vineyards, Packing & Cold Storage facility is a processing facility for potatoes and a cold storage facility for potatoes and table grapes. The facility has two ammonia processes that

provide refrigeration capacity to multiple cold r

ooms, two chlorination processes that provide water treatment to the potato processing area, and two sulfur-dioxide storage areas for SO2 cylinders

used for table grape fumigation in all of the cold rooms.



1.3 GENERAL ACCIDENT RELEASE & CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



1.3.1 GENERAL



We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss

preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.



Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the

purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in the body of the program.



1.3.2 ANHYDROUS AMMONIA



The ammonia refrigeration systems at the Giumarra Vineyards, Packing & Cold Storage facility are an integral part of the overall business and operate most of the year. The north system contains

a total charge of approximately 28,400 lbs and the south system contains approximately 54,000 lbs. It is extremely important that these systems are maintained and operated in a safe and

efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.



Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration system/process and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the

system/process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity review of our

ammonia equipment.



1.3.3 CHLORINE



The chlorination processes at the Giumarra Vineyards, Packing & Cold Storage facility are an integral part of the potato processing business which ope

rates for only a few months out of the year.

The Pit System utilizes one 2,000 lb cylinder, with another cylinder stored next to it as a backup.



The Potato Wash system utilizes two 2,000 lb cylinders connected to the process simultaneously. During the off-season, all four cylinders are stored at the Pit System location. As with the

ammonia systems management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of a chlorine leak.



Giumarra Vineyards personnel monitor the chlorination system/process. In addition, the system/process is checked frequently during the operational season, be our outside water treatment

contractor, SEACO. SEACO also assists in performing the annual mechanical integrity review of our chlorine equipment.



1.4 FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.



1.5 EMERGENCY ACTION AND RESPONSE PLAN



Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:

? California "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 8 CCR ?3220

? Federal "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38

? California "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 8 CCR Title 8 ?5192(q)

? Federal "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 29 CFR ?1910.120(q)



1.6 PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Our company has an outstanding safety record, one that we are quite proud of. Many policies and procedures have been implemented to promote overall plant, worker and public safety.

Nevertheless, Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage's ability to communicate

hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWri

ter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage's management team can ensure that the

RMP-PSM program is being implemented.



Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process

hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has

been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.



In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help

with RMP-PSM program implementation. A copy of Resource Compliance's service agreement has been included in this program with the support material.



For the future, Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Giumarra Vineyards Cold

Storage employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage will continue to maintain overall plant worker and

public safety.
